009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.QRDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements line fitting by orthogonal regression to a set of 2D
023 * points by solving a homogeneous linear system. See Sec. 6.7.1 of [1] and Sec.
024 * 10.2.2 (Alg. 10.2) of [2] for additional details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Gander, M. J. Gander, and F. Kwok. "Scientific Computing â€“ An
028 * Introduction using Maple and MATLAB". Springer (2014). <br>
029 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
030 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2022/09/29
035 * 
036 * @see OrthogonalLineFitEigen
037 * @see OrthogonalLineFitSvd
038 */
039public class OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous implements LineFit {
040        
041        private final Pnt2d[] points;
042        private final double[] p;       // algebraic line parameters A,B,C
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor, performs a orthogonal regression fit to the specified points.
046         * At least two different points are required.
047         * 
048         * @param points an array with at least 2 points
049         */
050        public OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous(Pnt2d[] points) {
051                if (points.length < 2) {
052                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
053                }
054                this.points = points;
055                this.p = fit();
056        }
057        
058        @Override
059        public int getSize() {
060                return points.length;
061        }
062        
063        @Override
064        public double[] getLineParameters() {
065                return p;
066        }
067        
068        private double[] fit() {
069                final int n = points.length; //.max(3, pts.length);
070                final double[][] X = new double[n][3];
071                
072                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
073                        X[i][0] = 1;
074                        X[i][1] = points[i].getX();
075                        X[i][2] = points[i].getY();
076                }
077                
078                QRDecomposition qr = new QRDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(X));
079                RealMatrix R = qr.getR();
080                
081//              RealMatrix RR = R.getSubMatrix(1, 2, 1, 2);
082                RealMatrix RR = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(2,2);
083                RR.setEntry(0, 0, R.getEntry(1, 1));
084                RR.setEntry(0, 1, R.getEntry(1, 2));
085                if (R.getRowDimension() >= 3) {
086                        RR.setEntry(1, 1, R.getEntry(2, 2));
087                }
088        
089                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(RR);
090                
091                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
092                double[] s = svd.getSingularValues();
093                int k = Matrix.idxMin(s);
094                double[] e = V.getColumn(k);
095                
096                double R01 = R.getEntry(0, 1);
097                double R02 = R.getEntry(0, 2);
098                double R00 = R.getEntry(0, 0);
099
100                double A = e[0];
101                double B = e[1];
102                double C = ( -A * R01 - B * R02) / R00;
103                return new double[] {A,B,C};
104        }
105
106}
